main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties

Class MMDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • main.java.embl.rieslab.emu.micromanager.mmproperties.MMDevice

  • public class MMDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    Class representing a device loaded in Micro-Manager. It holds a map for the different device properties. The class is used to sort the properties in the UI configuration Wizard (PropertiesTable).
    Author:
    Joran Deschamps

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MMDevice(java.lang.String deviceLabel)
      Creates a device with label deviceLabel.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String getDeviceLabel()
      Returns the label of the device.
      java.lang.String getHashFromLabel(java.lang.String propertyLabel)
      Returns the hash of the property with label propertyLabel.
      java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,MMProperty> getProperties()
      Returns the properties map.
      java.lang.String[] getPropertyHashes()
      Returns a String array containing the hashes of all known properties.
      java.lang.String[] getPropertyLabels()
      Returns a String array containing the labels of all known properties.
      boolean hasHashProperty(java.lang.String propertyHash)
      Checks if the properties map already contains the a property indexed by propertyHash.
      boolean hasLabelProperty(java.lang.String propertyLabel)
      Same as hasHashProperty(String), albeit with the property label instead of the hash.
      void registerProperty(MMProperty p)
      Adds the property p to the properties map.

      • MMDevice

        public MMDevice(java.lang.String deviceLabel)
        Creates a device with label deviceLabel.
        Parameters:
        deviceLabel - Label of the device

    • Method Detail

      • registerProperty

        public void registerProperty(MMProperty p)
        Adds the property p to the properties map. If a property with the same hash already exists, then nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        p -

      • hasHashProperty

        public boolean hasHashProperty(java.lang.String propertyHash)
        Checks if the properties map already contains the a property indexed by propertyHash.
        Parameters:
        propertyHash - Hash of the property.
        Returns:
        True if the property hash is contained in the properties map, false otherwise.

      • hasLabelProperty

        public boolean hasLabelProperty(java.lang.String propertyLabel)
        Same as hasHashProperty(String), albeit with the property label instead of the hash.
        Parameters:
        propertyLabel - Label of the property.
        Returns:
        True if a property with the same label exists in the map, false otherwise.

      • getHashFromLabel

        public java.lang.String getHashFromLabel(java.lang.String propertyLabel)
        Returns the hash of the property with label propertyLabel. If the property is not found, the method returns null.
        Parameters:
        propertyLabel - Label of the property.
        Returns:
        Hash of the corresponding property, null if the property is unknown.

      • getDeviceLabel

        public java.lang.String getDeviceLabel()
        Returns the label of the device.
        Returns:
        Device label.

      • getPropertyHashes

        public java.lang.String[] getPropertyHashes()
        Returns a String array containing the hashes of all known properties.
        Returns:
        Property hashes.

      • getPropertyLabels

        public java.lang.String[] getPropertyLabels()
        Returns a String array containing the labels of all known properties.
        Returns:
        Property labels.

      • getProperties

        public java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,MMProperty> getProperties()
        Returns the properties map. Each MMProperty is indexed by its hash.
        Returns:
        Properties map.
